de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.discovery

Class DiscoveryThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.discovery.DiscoveryThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DiscoveryServer

    public abstract class DiscoveryThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    This abstract class serves as a skeleton for implementing both the discovery server implementation as well as the discovery client implementation.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiscoveryThread

        public DiscoveryThread(java.lang.String selfName,
                       int localCommandPort,
                       int localDataPort)
        Create a new DiscoveryThread when you already know your command- and data port, for example for use in a server announcing where to connect.
        Parameters:
        selfName - the discovery thread will announce this name to other devices seeking partners in the network
        localCommandPort - a command server must be listening on this port to receive further communication
        localDataPort - a data server should be listening here to receive further communication

      • DiscoveryThread

        public DiscoveryThread(java.lang.String selfName)
        Create a new DiscoveryThread. Only use this constructor if you do not yet know your command- and data port (!), most probably when you want to implement a client, as a server not responding with a valid command port is useless.
        Parameters:
        selfName - the discovery thread will announce this name to other devices seeking partners in the network

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public abstract void run()
        This function must be overridden to complete the DiscoveryThread. You probably want to do something like 
              while(started())
          listen();
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • sendSelfIdentification

        public void sendSelfIdentification(java.net.InetAddress targetHost,
                                   int targetPort)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Send an object identifying the configured network device.
        Parameters:
        targetHost - to which target the message should be sent
        targetPort - at which discoveryPort the message should arrive on targetHost
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the identification message could not be sent

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the thread. To quote the java api specification "It is never legal to start a thread more than once. In particular, a thread may not be restarted once it has completed execution." Use hasRun() to check whether you may start the thread
        Overrides:
        start in class java.lang.Thread

      • hasRun

        public boolean hasRun()
        Check whether this threads start() has already been called. If it returns true, start() must not be called on this instance, since threads cannot be restarted.
        Returns:
        true if this thread has already been started

      • listen

        protected void listen()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Wait for a NetworkDevice object to arrive on the set DatagramSocket. Other messages will be discarded.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - either a SocketTimeoutException if the wait times out, or any other IO exception that occurse

      • onDiscovery

        protected abstract void onDiscovery(NetworkDevice newDevice)
        Called when listen() gets a discovery message
        Parameters:
        newDevice - the device that sent the message

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Check whether the server is set to stay running
        Returns:
        true if the server will continue running

      • getSocket

        protected java.net.DatagramSocket getSocket()
        Get the socket currently configured to be used by the discovery system
        Returns:
        socket currently used by the discovery system

      • setSocket

        protected void setSocket(java.net.DatagramSocket socket)
                  throws java.net.SocketException
        Set the socket to be used by this DiscoveryThread
        Parameters:
        socket - new socket configuration
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - if some of the configuration failed

      • setPorts

        public void setPorts(int commandPort,
                     int dataPort)
        Call this to set the ports that will be sent as the current devices ports
        Parameters:
        commandPort - the port where we will listen for commands
        dataPort - the port where we will listen for data (if server)

      • close

        public void close()
        Signal the running while loop to stop
